snippet: The group claiming to have seized the hostages identified itself as the Tripolitania Province of the Islamic State, named for the region around the capital, Tripoli, in western Libya.
abstract: Militants in Libya who have identified themselves as Tripolitania Province of Islamic State say that they are holding 21 Egyptian Christians captive; rise of third known Libyan affiliate of Islamic State group points to possibility that its influence is bleeding out beyond Syria and Iraq.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya.

lead_paragraph: The group claiming to have seized the hostages identified itself as the Tripolitania Province of the Islamic State, named for the region around the capital, Tripoli, in western Libya.

headline.main: Libyan Militants Aligned With Islamic State Claim Kidnapping of 21 Egyptian Christians
headline.print_headline: Libyan Militants Aligned With Islamic State Claim Kidnapping of 21 Egyptian Christians

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
